International Week at ISM, 24th -28th October 2011
Dear Parents,
It’s time to celebrate the rich cultural diversity of our school community. At ISM we are extremely proud of the international nature of our school. To celebrate this and to develop a wider understanding of the global community within which our students live and learn, we are planning an International week at school. In recognition of this we are extending it from a day to become an International Week of celebrations.
For Years 1-3
This year during the International week each class will focus on a country (not from our student community) and learn in depth about these following countries.
1A- Canada 1F- Mongolia 1M- Thailand
2C- Vietnam 2D- Qatar
3C- Jamaica 3D- Madagascar 3S- Peru
Your support in helping with information, books, souvenirs, music, costumes, pamphlets, food and/or flags for any of the above mentioned countries would be much appreciated and welcomed by all. It will make the teaching and learning meaningful and fun!
The week will begin with a quiz on Monday and the celebration of our cultural diversity will continue with an assembly with international music and multi cultural games (for students only) on Friday.
Friday-28th October: Dress up day- National costumes, flag colours
All parents of Lower school (Foundation stage and Y1 to 3) are invited to school on Friday 28th October at 8.30 – 10.00 am. On this day you and your children are welcome to come to school dressed in your national costume/flag colours/ football
t-shirts. Also please bring a plate of a national dish to share with other children and parents in the class. This would give everyone a true taste of being part of an international community. You will be able to participate with your child in completing an activity set out by the teacher and then to sample some of the food.
Foundation stage will continue the celebrations by focussing on different countries for the rest of the day. Please contact your child’s teacher if you would like to help.
School will finish as normal at 3.20pm.
Looking forward to seeing you all at school on Friday the 28th Of October.
We are very grateful for your continued support.
Thank you,
P. Arora
